trial_identification.studytitle: Metabolic effects of oestrogen compounds in men with low testosterone
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Metabolic effects of SERMs (Selective Oestrogen Receptor Modulators) in hypogonadal men

conditions.healthcondition: Metabolic effects in men with low testosterone

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal metabolism and endocrine development and function

interventions.interventions: Raloxifene (120 mg) as 2 oral tablets a day for 6 months
interventions.comparator: placebo (sugar pill), 2 tablets a day for 6 month

primaryOutcome.outcome: Growth hormone (GH) secretion after arginine stimulation, measured by GH Elisa kit, Bioclone Australia
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 1 and 6 months of treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Whole body protein turnover by leucine turnover technique.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 1 and 6 months of treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Fat and lean body mass by Dual energy xray absorptiometry (DEXA).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 1 and 6 months of treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Measurements of fat oxidation by indirect calorimetry
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 1 and 6 months of treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Biochemical markers of growth hormone - insulin-like growth factor I (GH-IGFI) axis measured by radioimmuno assay.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and after 1 and 6 months of treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Hypogonadism (prostate cancer patients on androgen deprivation therapy for at least 6 months)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Androgen deprivation for less than 6 months, metastasis, cancer in other tissues than prostate, diabetes, kidney and liver disease, deep vein thrombosis

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Department of Endocrinology, St Vincent's Hospital

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We aim to investigate the effects of raloxifene (SERM) in hypogonadal men on the growth hormone system and metabolism.
